N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1035.3 - Paratransit eligibility: process

State Regulations
(a) Eligibility for paratransit services
shall be limited to individuals specified in section
1035.2
of this Part who are
determined to be eligible by the authority's eligibility process, which may
include any or all of the following elements: (1)
an application form to be completed by
each applicant; (2)
an in-person
assessment of the applicant by a certifier designated by the
authority; (3)
a processing fee; and
(4)
a recent photograph of the
individual for use on an ADA-paratransit eligibility identification
card. (b) Information
about paratransit services; the application, certification and appeal
processes; and procedures for securing paratransit services shall be made
available in accessible formats, upon request. (c) If, within the time period specified
below from the date of submission of a complete application, the authority has
not made a determination of eligibility, the applicant shall be treated as
paratransit-eligible and provided service until and unless the authority denies
the application. The time periods for determining eligibility are: (1)
1993 and 1994: 45 calendar days from date
of receipt of application; (2)
1995: 30 calendar days from date of receipt of application; and
(3)
1996 and thereafter: 21 calendar days
from date of receipt of application. (d) The authority's determination concerning
eligibility shall be in writing. If the determination is that the individual is
ineligible, the determination shall state the reasons for the
finding. (e) The authority shall
provide each paratransit-eligible individual with an identification card
displaying at least the following: the name of the eligible individual; the
telephone number of the authority's paratransit coordinator; a recent
photograph of the individual; an expiration date for eligibility; and any
conditions or limitations on the individual's eligibility, including the use of
a personal care attendant. (f) Trip
reservations may be made only by or on behalf of an individual with a current
ADA-paratransit eligibility identification card. (g) Redetermination of an individual's
continued eligibility for paratransit services may be conducted every three
years. The authority may charge a fee for such redetermination, and may
prescribe the period in which the redetermination application must be submitted
in order to prevent expiration of eligibility. (h) Individuals who have been granted
temporary eligibility for paratransit services as described in section
1035.2
(c) of this

Part will be responsible for reapplying if, at the time of the expiration date
of such eligibility, they believe they are entitled to a new eligibility
period. (i) Any individual who is
denied eligibility for paratransit services in whole or in part may appeal that
determination in writing to the authority within 60 days of its date of
issuance. The appeal may be made entirely through submission of written
statements and documents, or through an in-person hearing. A request for a
hearing shall be made at the same time the request is made to appeal the
eligibility decision. (j) An
individual may be represented by an attorney or other representative at a
hearing to appeal an eligibility decision. (k) A determination of an appeal of an
eligibility decision will be made by an individual or panel of individuals who
were not involved in the initial determination of eligibility. (l) Decisions of eligibility appeals will be
made in writing, within the time periods specified in this subdivision, that
shall run from the date of receipt of the written appeal, or from the date the
hearing is concluded, as applicable. The authority is not required to provide
paratransit service during the period that an appeal is pending. Where an
appeal has not been decided within the specified period, an individual will be
entitled to eligibility from the first day after the end of the specified
period until the determination of the appeal has been made. The time periods
for deciding an appeal are: (1)
1993: 60
calendar days from date of receipt of written appeal or from the date the
hearing is concluded; (2)
1994: 45
calendar days from date of receipt of written appeal or from the date the
hearing is concluded; (3)
1995 and
thereafter: 30 calendar days from date of receipt of written appeal or from the
date the hearing is concluded. Notes
